Key Match Events: Jan Vertonghen's late own goal took France into the quarter-finals of Euro 2024.
Substitute Randal Kolo Muani's shot deflected off Vertonghen to score the only goal of the match.
Theo Hernandez made a brilliant saving block to deny Yannick Carrasco.
Mike Maignan made crucial saves to deny Romelu Lukaku and Kevin De Bruyne.
Pre-Game Insights: France were widely seen as the favorites to win this tournament before arriving in Germany.
Belgium was looking for revenge for their 1-0 defeat against France in the semi-finals of the 2018 World Cup.
Antoine Griezmann was dropped for the last group match against Poland but returned for this match.
Post-Match Reflections: France remains on course to become European champions for the third time.
Belgium bow out after what will go down as a disappointing tournament for them.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France are yet to score from open play in four matches at the tournament.
France has conceded only one goal, from a penalty, so far in the tournament.
